review: Good, sometimes. Service is consistent as you would expect from somewhere so corporate. Portion size good for the price but a little bland overall. Too much sugar in their sauces, drinks, and salad dressings! Sometimes causes a craving for bbq chicken......!

If you like cheap beer and work in Beverly Hills... This is a best kept secret. The beers here are SO cheap. Look I know it's a family establishment but if you need a few cold one's after a long day with a tasty pizza (who doesn't??) then go here. I've had the habanero pizza twice now. Other fav's are the tostada and thai chicken. You really can't go wrong. This is a much smaller CPK than most I've been to.

Can't believe we came back here.  Again, terrible service.  3 of us were nicely greeted by the manager at the host stand and were promptly sat at a table.  We waited approximately 5 minutes and no server ever came to our table.  We were on a lunch hour so we didn't have a lot of time to kill waiting for someone to come.  I got up and asked the manager that sat us if there was anyone assigned to our table.  She came over and took our order because there must have been some mixup with who got which tables.  She came back a few minutes later and dropped the drinks off.  Nobody came by our tables from the time the drinks were dropped off to when the food was delivered.  The manager (which we assumed as acting as our server because nobody else ever came by) never came back asking if we needed anything/how we liked the food and never refilled our drinks.  A server (which we later found out was supposedly our server) dropped off the check and asked if we needed any boxes as he set down the check.  We all asked for refills since nobody ever came by as we were eating.  So we basically got our first refill the same time the bill was taken.  We paid with a gift card and asked for change with a $20 for the tip.  The gift card had $.52 left which was never returned and we were given $19 change instead of $20.  Over 5 minutes passed and nobody ever came back by, so we asked the bus boy to grab the manager.  She came by and made excuses as to why our server didn't return the gift card and why we were short changed.  This place really doesn't have their act together.  There were probably 5-6 tables of customers, and at least 12 employees.  The female manager (2/10/12 @ noon) was literally chit chatting with the employees throughout our entire meal - this is the root problem as to why our service was bad.

My roommate & I come here today (CPK) have lunch. I order a wed salad and the salad look like old & left over two (2) or there (3) days ago. The bacon was very bad look old & taste very bad. And it's not taste fresh what I thought. This place (CPK) should be here. My advice for every body save your money & go some where else not this (CPK) place. I order desert it was terrible & taste very bad old cake bake three (3)  week ago. They do not know how to serve to the public a fresh good food Would you agree that ?? That how you want people to serve you when you eat any where & any place when you go out is that right ?? food should be fresh is that difficult to ask for ?? I will never go back here again (CPK) this location !!! The manager she come out to talk to me & she give me an attitude what a b*tch she is. I hope after peoplea see this review & read my review so they won't come here to eat at this dirty place and cheat to public serve food that left over from yesterday. So no body find out now I said it. That this place serve food left over from yesterday to the customer that wrong !!!. Please do NOT come here (CPK)  to eat be very careful !!!. I went home and I get sick from their dirty kitchen. And food that was bad & old contaminate (food poison.) Don't eat here.
I've been eating here since they first opened over 25 years ago. The food is always very good. I've never had a bad meal here. I've never had a bad meal at any CPK. I think it is an excellent chain.

I really like this location and staff! They always get my order right (whole wheat pizza crust) and the staff and manager are attentive and prompt.   You can sit outside, too. This location is my "escape" when I'm in Beverly Hills.  Food is excellent.

Good pizzas & salads.  But we came here for the BEST dessert: apple-crisp!  Only 3 stars because CPK has taken the apple crisp off the menu!!!  Bad move, I will probably come here 50% less than I have in the past.  The warm butter cake is ok, however nothing can replace the apple crisp.

CPK you seize to amaze me. I've been to a couple CPK's in the valley and always felt they were just okay, I guess it has to do with location?!!? My boyfriend and I arrived around 2pm and it wasn't too busy, we were seated right away. Traffic to get there on the other hand didn't make sense... streets and the freeway were crowd at 1:20 in the afternoon.  We took our seats outside and the weather was perfect :] nothing like some good ole sunshine. I had their refreshing mango iced tea and he got their raspberry lemonade both were really good and well flavored (no sweetener needed). He devoured the Sicilian thin crust pizza and give it two thumbs up. I got their Tricolore Salad Pizza and that was delicious, I'm in love with it. It's the best of both worlds -- a tasty salad & yummy thin pizza crust. The next time we stop in for lunch, I don't even need to look at the menu because I'm getting that Tricolore Salad Pizza! *Public parking structure is right across the street :] and when we paid it was $3

typical california pizza kitchen. the outdoor patio really is nice however you know that cars drive by and waiters aren't always around. The inside is great and servers are everywhere, and attentive. The small bites work great when you don't know what you want. This is just a great location in beverly hills and remember location location location. so if you want a fast bite this is a great go to place

MR. SUBLIMINAL I took my mother (mama's boy) to CPK for dinner ($50 gift card). we sat down and this waiter (I'm straight but he was hot) took our order. My mother had the Chinese (we use to call it Oriental before the country became sensitive) salad and I had the Wild Mushroom pizza (I know about mushrooms and these were not wild). they use to bring bread and butter to the table before the meal (Cheesecake Factory still does it). I would give it 5 stars but that bread and butter ordeal turned me off man. I still have money on my CPK gift card (any hot girls want to go to CPK?, WRITE ME). Overall it was a life changing experience.

We live down the street from this location so we frequent it for dinner. However on our last visit, we found a hair in our salad so I gave it to our waiter and told him what we found and that we didn't want another one to replace it. A couple minutes later, the manager Esther walks over to the table and says, "Can you describe the hair that you found; was it long or short? Dark or light?" I looked at her with my jaw hanging open. She didn't waver in the silence and eventually said, "I want to know so that I can see who isn't wearing their hairnet." ARE YOU KIDDING ME? She didn't apologize for the incident ONCE. As if I wasn't disgusted enough by finding a hair in my salad, the manager is going to ask me to describe it in detail? And not try to make amends?! I was dumbfounded and cannot believe that someone in a management position would behave like that. Come on, CPK, they should know better. I'm so disappointed.

One star is far too kind for what was once a quality, new taste kind of restaurant. Whoever the "genius" is that decided to first, stop chopping up their salads, then change the high quality real turkey breast for lunch meat that I have seen better quality in the cold section at 7-11 should be held accountable for not only loosing $3000 - $5000 per year of my business but for taking one of the items that put this place on the map and moved it all the way to the trash. I know the new "owners" who are really capital investors are looking to make a buck by switching quality for crap and thinking their customers are too stupid. Or do they just want customers who expect lesser quality. Thanks "Golden Gate Capital" for helping me decide never to eat at CPK ever again. In fact I even watched your waiters turn away 2 family's 7 minutes before you stop serving in front of the manager with the excuse that their watch showed it was 5 minutes past the hour. This was so they could eat with their girlfriend and not have too work. "Way to go, great example set".  SAD.

CPK has been declining for years and this week was my last visit.  Poor service, bad food, loud, dirty... just a horrible experience. The waiter claimed the thick spaghetti pasta was angel hair when it clearly was not, the bolognese sauce was dry, overspiced to compensate for flavorlessness, and they really skimped on it. The great crusty sourdough they used to serve has been replaced with pasty squishy wonder-like bread. The place was loud and chaotic - filled with children running amok and squealing.  The table was dirty and there were crumbs on our chairs when we were seated. The waiter delivered the food and disappeared. There are many great restaurants in the South Bev neighborhood, but this is one to avoid.

The prices and the food are rather decent. Tables are far too close to each other (at least for me). Its a good place to eat if you want something fast and cheap, it has a nice outside sitting area which can be enjoyable when we have nice LA weather. Parking might be a little hard to find depending on what time you go.

Bought 4 pizzas to go, found hair in two of them. I love CPK but this location is horrible. Besides the hairs, the pizzas themselves were awful, the cheese pizza didn't have sauce on the majority of the pizza and so little cheese that I could actually see through several slices. The Thai chicken was all peanut sauce and bean sprouts, not the usual way every other CPK makes it. The wild mushroom and pepperoni were both undercooked and too thin. Normally I love the bread from CPK but it was basically slices of sandwich bread not the normal toasted Italian bread. I will never eat at this CPK again.

I love California Pizza Kitchen.  I can't rate this location 5 stars because of the difficulty with the interior noise level.  There are so many families that visit this restaurant and because of the acoustics, the noise level is too high.  Along with that at times it feels as if I am eating a Chuck-E-Cheese with the children crying, running around and falling out of their chairs.  This is a very convenient place for the area and it is too bad it is not larger to accommodate the families in a family area.
Their pasta and pizza are good but overall the service is terrible. You literally have to wait over and hour just to get a seat and have a somewhat decent meal.

I know it's a chain and I realize it's in BH but I still love their Jamaican Jerk Pizza.  I think consistency can be an problem at some CPK's but thankfully the food and the service at this location were just fine. For those not in the know the Jamaican Jerk pizza is Spicy sweet Caribbean sauce, authentic Jamaican spices, applewood smoked bacon, onions and bell peppers. And here it is, really hit the spot after a long afternoon of shopping :)  I for one would come back to this location again.

I came here tonight for dinner takeout since nearly everything else is closed. I ordered a full size Cesar salad (~$12) with chicken (+$4) and a full size Chinese chicken salad (~$13). Service was OK, I wasn't greeted until a few minutes after I walked in (-1 star). Not a lot of customers in store. Took about 13 minutes for the food to be ready.  Now, the food is good enough, but a chicken cesar salad is NOT worth $16. After I drove back home, I discovered that they forgot the chicken in the Cesar salad. I'm too tired to go back but I called to tell them what's up. Me: Hi. I just ordered takeout from you guys and you forgot the chicken in the Cesar salad. Now, I'm not going to come back for it, but I thought you should know.  CPK employee: Oh. *pause* *disingenuously* We're sorry. Me: *pause* Thanks. Bye.  CPK employee: Bye.  Now they apologized, which is good (+1 star). But they clearly didn't care based off of  the half assed apology (-1 star). No offers to make my experience better or promises for what they will do next time (-1 star).  The takeout FAPS: Food: 4/5. Good when they remember what I ordered.  Atmosphere: 3/5. Slow. Parking: 3/5. It's Beverly drive, it's gonna be rough.  Service: 1/5. Could have been more engaging. Could have sincerely apologized for forgetting the chicken I paid $4 extra for. Could have told me what they would do differently next time. TL;DR: Food is good enough when they remember the order. Too pricey for basic food ($13 or $16 for a salad? Really?). If they screw up an order, they make no effort to correct it.

This is one of my favorite restaurants, no matter which location I go to, but this particular location has a cute outdoor patio section, with heaters! The only down side is the traffic noise on Beverly, but other than that, I would highly recommend this place for lunch or dinner

This location is really small. Our server was nice, but nothing special. The tables to our right and left had not been cleared the entire time we were there and it was a Tuesday night, so they weren't very busy.  We ordered the tortilla soup, which was good and the margarita pizza. The soup, WE THINK, made us sick because that evening we both had really bad stomach aches. I've had great experiences at some CPKS like the one in Westwood and Brentwood, but I wasn't a fan of this location. I recommend trying one of the other branches if you're in the mood for CPK and are not interested in having the remainder of other patron's dinner staring at you the entire night.
we order quite often from here for lunch.. and I have to say.. wow.. can ya lay off adding a whole onion to your salads and pasta dishes.. its a bit much.. wow.. will not order for awhile.... yuck...

maybe my expectations where high but the food is really just bland.  the service is great but the food is the reason to go to a restaurant, not the service.   though if not for the service, the review would be a one star.

I had a salad one night with a bowl of tortilla soup while i waited for my daughter to get off of work and i really think i should have just stuck to what i normally order which is usually the B-B-Q Chicken Pizza Or Jamaican Pizza because i felt like i really was wasting my money on this order. Not the greatest I've ever had...

have to tell you that i am a fan of the CPK franchise. every location has its own identity the one in beverly hills tries to clss up by having wine glasses on the table when you come in, good promotion, not my bag. but the food is good, the beer is cold. even though in beverly hills the 18 ounce beer is 4.50 and in culver city the liter is 4.50.\ we had a california veggie pizza, really good product, a bit lite on veggies but good, could use a little heaver hand on the toppings. we also had an italian chop salad, great size salad enough for two at lease, the toppings again a bit shy could use another handful of chopped salami and cheese to accent the salad the dressing one of the best i have had, usually not a fan but this time we had more, the dressing was thick and full of flavor. the beer was cold and good, my wife had hot tea, service was good, the servier like to cluster in the back and look at the customers, need to flag them if you need more. we were there after 5 pm so it was dinner hour, love the place, needs fine tuning and a little better portion extras to really show off the food. we will be back, and also the piza dough rewards program is a good idea, brings us back more.

CPK Lover's BEWARE! Not all CPK's are the same. They all have different Owners and this one is by far THE WORST.  The dough on their pizzas are soooo bad. Super thin, dry, and the crust is like cardboard. We noticed right away that their pizza looked different than other CPK's and mentioned it to the waiter when he brought ours out and he said they changed the recipe of the dough and this restaurant is the first one to change it, but all the others will soon follow. We were starving so we tried it anyways. I had half a slice and could not eat it anymore, and my husband (who normally eats the whole pizza by himself) had 1 1/2 slices. When the Waiter came to check on us, we told him the pizza was REALLY BAD. He said, "Next time let me know before you eat half of it and I might be able to offer you something different" and walked away. We were so offended. I asked to speak to the Manager. A young kid comes out, and he was nice and apologized for the terrible pizza and bad attitude of the server...and that was it. Didn't offer to compensate us for the pizza, (even though we didn't touch half of it) he simply said sorry, admitted that we are not the only ones who have complained about the pizza dough, and handed me the check. Wow....this CPK does not deserve to carry the brand's name.

We walked in on a Thursday evening, a little pressed for time as we were hungry and wanted to eat before an important event.  After scanning the dining room, I got nervous that we would not have enough time to get our order in, get our food, eat and get out on time.  I let our server, Will, know that I was concerned and he was very helpful and let us know approximately how much time it would take to get our food based orders ahead of us (which I could tell was without any preferential treatment).   So suffice to say, everything worked out perfectly and it was really nice to be in a place where someone actually cared... Thank You Will!!  Thank You California Pizza Kitchen... We will be back!

So here we are, maybe it's the problem with being chain restaurant, I could see the staff where all around, and the restaurant not being busy no one really was caring. Our waitress was nice, the food was ok, pizzas came out too dry for me though and the atmosphere of restaurant was too depressing and the decor was over done with mirrors all over the wall and the color selection. I've tasted better Ca Pizzas in other location.

MY BAD FOR TRUSTING THE TAKE-OUT COUNTER I ordered a soup through their online system last week and SPECIFICALLY put please ADD bread to go with my TORTILLA SOUP.  Open the bag when I got back to work and what is missing? FREAKING BREAD..  Today I ordered 2 bowls of tortilla soup over the phone and specifically asked for BREAD and my tortilla strips to be inside my bag.  I sent someone over to pick up my order and when I opened the bag what is missing? TORTILLA STRIPS, wtf!?!  How do you give me part of my meal.. Soooo I called and asked for a Manager and Camille was a super smart ass.  She apologize and then said well maybe you should had looked in your bag before you left (2 eyes would be better).... My mouth drop like 4 REAL AS A MANAGER THIS IS HOW YOU TALK TO A REPEAT COSTUMER... Due to me being pregnant, I had to calm myself down and just hang up.  I have been a faithful CPK rider for 10 years but I'm done due to her lack of customer service skills... SUPER RUDE!!

I prefer the thai salad and pizza. I remember it tasting better in seattle by the airport than in beverly hills.  They said they are changing their dough recipe. I definitely like the old dough better.

I have been going to this location since I was a kid. Typical CPK location with good service and clean setting. I love the fact that CPK recently redid their menus and offer weekly new dishes that sometimes taste great but other times are just a failure. Good food and good service.
I love most of the foods at CPK, but my favorite wood be the chipotle chicken pasta. Try it next time you are there and you'll understand, unless you don't like spicy foods.

Went here today with a friend for lucnxh . Got the tostada pizza and the pizza was much different . Didn't taste good at all. My friend got an appetizer and she said it was okay . The food here has low to literally now taste reminds me why I hardy come here . Only good part today was the service was excellent

We went here with our 3 "little" kids and it was "good". So def family friendly. Free wifi (so you can keep kids busy on smart phones, tablets). Kids meal were good and fast. Nice staff. Paper and crayons for kids. So overall good experience.

Our office staff are loyal delivery users from this store since we NEVER get a lunch break. The delivery guys are super polite and very efficient. On this particular day I snuck out of the office to do a pick up since the delivery guy was sick.  First, I had to ask the girl to give me tortilla strips for my tortilla soup, which should usually come with it. Then, I asked for butter with the bread and first she said, we don't do butter anymore, we do oil. Then she went to get the rest of my order and when she returned I asked again, so you don't have butter anywhere in the restaurant? To that she responded, I guess I can go ask... Was it that big of a deal?? Lastly, I get back to the office to find that my tortilla soup I ordered wasn't tortilla soup... it was pea soup. Does no one check the orders?? I called the manager and he was no help. Said I could come pick up my money since I paid cash.  Wow, thanks a lot. Great customer service, CPK- NOT!!!!

Not a fan of chain restaurants but this location always has friendly staff and good food. I love their soups and they offer decent finds as well. If you have to go with a name and a dinner that is consistent than this is your place.

I visited CPK in Beverly Hills today with my friends. The food was as good as expected, but the service ruined everything. Our server Eli was not attentive at all. To change the dirty glasses on our table took 10 minutes during that time we could not have a sip of water. He didn't not come to our table during our meal to ask us if everything is all right. He didn't acknowledge that our meal was done and we needed a check, so we had to ask somebody else to bring it. on our way out of the restaurant, we took the exit thru patio door, Eli was walking a step in front of us to attend somebody there, so he didn't even hold the door for us, just closed it on our faces.

FOOD: + Flavor was pretty blah. I ordered a Moroccan-Spiced Chicken Salad which also had beets, butternut squash, hardboiled egg, etc. There was literally no flavor, which I guess shouldn't surprise me since it's a chain restaurant and most things are pre-made or pre-prepped.  + The only gluten-free options on the menu are in the salads category. There are 4 choices. + Sounds silly... but their water tastes good. Great temp and good quality; perfect with a lime squeezed in. STAFF & SERVICE: + Friendly and kindly asked about some gluten-free questions that I had about the menu. + Quick to bring out the meal (although we did only order soup and salads)
Ordered a Chinese Chicken Salad. The interior was frozen still when they served it to me. The other dishes my family ordered were bland too. Forget this chain. Go elsewhere.
Love that this restaurant is so conscious about keeping food free of cross contamination with allergens.  Hope that more restaurants will follow CPK's lead in the future.

My friend and I decided to order takeout from here. We called ahead and they said thirty minutes for the order. My friend told them it was too long to wait so they finally said twenty. We were already across the street so we grabbed coffee and walked over. The order was ready. Staff was friendly.  My friend lives about five minutes away. When we got to her house and started eating the pizza was soggy and cold and they gave her a quarter full ramekin of BBQ for her BBQ chicken salad. She called and spoke to the manager Luis and he was very helpful and acted appropriately. Overall. I really like CPK but was just disappointed in the food tonight. Their staff however was accommodating and the manager helpful.
I always have a great time in the restaurant, I believe I tried ALL of their items on the menu! I love their cobb salad, customized pizza, garlic fettuccine and all of their desserts!

I've been here a couple of times and the staff has been very accommodating to us. One time we came with a lot of kids and they were very helpful. The food comes out quickly and even though the caloric count is high there are some healthy options. Obviously for health reasons you can't go here frequently but it's a treat and the kids love it.

THEY ARE SO RUDE. I called to place a take out order and they kept transfering me and putting me on hold. I felt like no one wanted to take my order. One woman in particular was SO rude and she gave me so much attitude after I asked her how much longer it will take because I was already on hold for 10 minutes. She told me that she was just too busy. IN FACT - everyone I spoke to told me they were too busy. After 15 minutes some guy picked up the phone and asked for my order then stopped me just as I began to order and asked if I would mind if he put me on hold and as I was telling him that I did not want to be on hold HE PUT ME ON HOLD ANYWAY! after another 5 minutes I finally hung up and walked to the restaurant to place the order (it was an urgent lunch order for work). When I got there EVERYONE was just sitting around there were barely any people in there... it was around 11:30 am. Their laziness was DISGUSTING. Had it not been for the big order we had already collected for a meeting at work.. I would have given up on them. Later when we picked up the food it was cold and honestly not that great. Definitely not worth the hassle. OUR OFFICE (and I personally) WILL NEVER ORDER FROM THEM AGAIN... LAZY and RUDE people.  Side note - I would never eat at this location after going there... there is a weird smell in the restaurant... maybe just the day I was there, but it was enough to make me not want to go back.

I've been  going to this CPK location for years, but lately their service really gone down hill. The last few times we were there the servers took forever to attend to our table, although the restaurant was not busy at all. And just last week when I ordered for pick up they messed up my order and forgot the drinks. It really too bad, because it's so convenient... What happened CPK?
from time to time I do take out for dinner. the food is okay but sometimes I feel that the menu is very boring to me, nothing new. It's like having the same meal over and over again.

Met my cousin here for lunch recently, and we both ordered a half portion of their roasted veggie salad, in which I added some grilled chicken.  I love this salad, and I love even more that their half portion is quite filling and plentiful.  In addition to lots of lettuce, this salad comes with roasted bell peppers, asparagus, eggplant, artichoke hearts, and avocado (plus the chicken).  Lots of my favorite things, all with great flavor.  It comes with a Dijon vinaigrette dressing, but I don't always love that...... sometimes it just comes out too sweet.  I'm not really sure where the Dijon part is, but it's definitely heavy on the balsamic vinegar flavor, which is just okay.  Still and all, I love the salad. Location is south of Wilshire on Beverly Blvd, so it's a little easier to manage parking wise.  At a minimum, there is a garage directly across the street, and the first 2 hours are free.  If you are into a sweet finish to a meal, go a few steps around the corner from here, and you're at 'Lette Macarons.  All you foodies out there already know the place, but for those of you who don't, go find out why I mention them.  Anyway, I digress......... CPK is always a nice, reliable chain option for lunch in the ultra chic and expensive Beverly Hills.

The food is always what you expect. Not great food but consistent. Great for lunch and families with young kids. My biggest complaint with this BH location is that the restaurant always smells like a dirty mop so we tend to sit outside

I loved cpk. There pizza is horrible ever since they changed the recipe. I grew up in BH eating cpk pizza since it opened. I will never go back. They lost a lifetime customer. Just wanted to put it simply one more time 1. Open pizza place 2. Pizza so good that business becomes wildly successful.  3. Change pizza that made business successful ? Does anyone see the stupidity ?

I went here for my birthday once. This place is great. The food was great! I loved the service but one thing i did not like is that the refills cost $3 each time. I ordered chicken piccata here and it is very good! It has a side of pasta noodles which is also great! I would recommend this place! Best sitting area is the outside patio!

They just recently remodeled the restaurant. Looks great!  This is a great place for families. Their smashed pea soup is so good, and their pizzas are huge but yummy. If you get a pizza for yourself, you'll have leftovers so I recommend sharing.

Love coming here to sit out on the patio and relax while having their Cobb Salad, which is one of my favorite menu items. They did recently raise some of their prices, and the service outside could be a bit better, but overall this location still does it for me :)

Boy, this place really lacks customer service when the lunch hour is over. The server do not receive with a friendly hello, pretty much asks what you want while the keep cleaning. Geee sorry to bother you.

There is a public parking lot around with a flat rate of 5 dollars, so parking is not a big issue. Could sit outdoor and indoor. Food is quite good. Especially the salads! Would definitely visit again.

I usually go to CPK in culver city, but it was my first time coming to this location. I thought it was just  takeout. However, as soon as i got in the receptionist came to me greeted me very nicely and took me and my party to the table right away. I believe my servers name was Hunter. He was very friendly and nice. The food took a bit long to come but it was a worth of wait.  The food was extremely Tasty and mouth watering. I ordered chipotle pizza, kung pao spaghetti and thai chicken salad.  Everything was on point. Awesome food! Awesome service! Good job!

if you haven't had their butter cake, drop what you are doing and go get one right now. YUMMM!! I recently also had the s'mores. meh. I was really excited about it but the chocolate was cool and wasn't as "wow" tasting as it was "wow" looking.

Wild mushroom pizza and quinoa-arugula salad. The dressing was delicious (champagne vinaigrette), and the feta/sun dried tomato combo satisfied me. So yummy! Forgot what the drink's name was but it was sweet & tropical tasting- added the perfect touch to this dinner. (It was included Malibu/white wine, mango purée, pineapple, and apple juice I think). Look for it on the drink menu, it's a must.

Pretty good experience, attentive waitress that didn't pester too much. Very friendly manager and food was great and arrived quickly.  The only thing is the restaurant has a cramped feel to it even when half empty.  Free 2 hour parking directly across the street was helpful.

While the wife and I have been fans of CPK for years, I felt compelled to comment on the friendly,  courteous servers at this establishment.  From the moment we walked in the door, we were made to feel welcome and important.  Our server, Remone,  took the time to go over the new menu and offer suggestions.  Top notch service and we were very pleased.

Yes, it's a chain, yada yada. But this place is ALWAYS great! They have awesome small plate options, fresh, yummy pizzas. The staff is attentive. The drinks are fresh. The wine and beer list rocks. Everything is clean, fast and lovely. The only thing is, inside this particular location can get loud if there are a ton of kids. My husband and I usually opt for OUTSIDE. Otherwise, YES CPK! CPK ON!

Okay, let me start off by saying I love CPK and it never disappointing. EXCEPT for the Beverly Hills location EVERY SINGLE TIME.  I live near this location and have been going for years. I don't know what is in the water, but every employee at this location is on island time. Hold up - last time I check LA isn't and  island mon so step up the game. My most recent experience here consisted of me ordering off their "new" menu which sucks. Oh, I didn't mention the BIG BLACK HAIR was not in my order. Yup, I found the longest, grossest, black hair in my salad. I quickly showed my waiter and then the manager. They eventually brought us a new salad and then the check -- WITH THE SALAD STILL ON IT. UH HELLO. When a customer finds a sick a** hair in their salad, you should comp it. It's too bad Tabatha doesn't take over restaurants because if she did the entire STAFF here would be up sh**creek.
Food is decent here, but it's crowded and they will try to rush you out the door (ask you if you want desert and bring your receipt while you are still eating).

Came here with my wife for dinner.  Great atmosphere and we love the outdoor seating.  We ordered a salad, appetizer and main dish with Carribean Sangria. We had the Asparagus and Arugula Salad which tasted good with the light cheese and peanuts.  Then we had the crispy mac & cheese.  I guess we weren't thinking of Mac & cheese flat ball but it was okay.  And for our main dish we had a fish with this grain that reminded me of mom's cooking, definitely a plus!  Unfortunately I don't remember the name nor do I see it on the online menu, must be a special.  The sangria was between poor to okay quality. Overall, the food was good and the service too!

i love cpk, loathe the BH location. rudest take out people i've ever spoken to. they got my order wrong then blamed me. my office will not be ordering from BH CPK ever again. i've never experienced anything like it!

YUMMMMMMMYYYYY!! BEST SERVICE!! Ben, you're great. The managers are all great. Dog loving environment. They totally accommodated me and my sister when we brought our dog and they even came out a few times to make sure she was ok! Sooo friendly.
Took too long for our food to arrive, poor service and worst of it all salad seemed it was few days old and far from being fresh.
We were able to be seated right away and had great service by Jose. I love the Chinese chicken salad.

I have always loved CPK but this recent visit turned me sour. There was constant foot traffic coming in the back door from Beverly Drive, to use the restroom. It was very disruptive. They could care less about their customers, otherwise they would stop allowing this.  The place was very noisy and dirty. The food was okay, but not the same as it used to be. We were disappointed we couldn't order a cappuccino after lunch. The server seemed anxious for us to free up the table, so we left. It was not relaxing or enjoyable in the least. I WILL NEVER BE BACK.

I am personally a fan of CPK. However, I am not convinced with this location. The waiters here are too good but too slow as well. we ordered some water, and it takes more than 5 minutes to serve it. The waiter took another 10 mins before he came and took the order. And guess what ?? the waiter explains the food very well but it doesn't taste like what he explains. we get our starter in 15 minutes !! We ordered some garlic added pizza, and the garlic was so raw in the pizza and our mouths started to stink. The waiter never said it would have so much garlic. It took about 30 mins to serve the pizza. I had to go and ask for some water at the counter to get it as there was no waiter to care for our corner table.  Avoid this place if you are too hungry. Go here if you want to spend some quality time with friends/family and don't care about serving times.

New Year's Day in need of lunch to fuel some studyin' but didn't feel like cookin', there weren't many restos open in my zipcode 'cept for CPK. Place was jammin'.  Would have preferred a two-top but a single at the bar was no waiting, spacious, expeditious for me.  Reprised the Asparagus and Arugula Salad tossed in housemade lemon vinaigrette with sun-dried tomatoes, toasted almonds and shaved Parmesan with a celebratory 6-ounces of chardonnay to toast '15, make the learnin' go down. Spicy Fennel Sausage & Poblano Flatbread - Mozzarella, fire-roasted chilies, wild Greek oregano, spicy marinara. HOT, HOT, HOT, filling! Server Brendan and the manager checked in on me several times tempted me with dessert but my '15 resolution is like every other year, either vino or sweets, never both so I passed.  CPK can cook for me any time I'd rather not!  Someday I might even move on from the small plates menu...

For a chain CPK is one of the better ones, but still not really stand out. I was obsessed with their roasted veggie pizza, but they no longer carry it. The salads are good, but far from healthy, pizzas are good but kind of on the small side and I always get their egg rolls. Service is ok, a bit slow and prices a bit higher than they need to be for chain food. Wouldn't go out of my way to come back, but it was fine.

My wife and I visited this place on the eve of Valentine's day which was also our 6th anniversary.  We loved the place and the food and drinks were stupendous. The guy who served us was very gentle and spent a very good time to explain on various items. My wife and I have become fan of CPK and will be visiting the place quite often from now onwards.

I am making this location my first review for CPK since they have the whole 'Reimagined Menu', which means they offer things not available in most locations.  About ready to order one of my usual defaults (turkey/chicken club sandwich on ciabtta-they no longer have focaccia bread), I noticed they had a classic crispy chicken sandwich and a oven-roasted turkey with brie that I've never seen before. I decided on the turkey since it has pears and honey mustard, which intrigued me. Pears tend to do that.  But what got me most excited was the baked potato soup and a s'mores dessert. I chose the soup over the usual caesar salad, and got the dessert to go. In all honesty, the soup was good, not great, and the dessert I feel would taste much better eating it there in the establishment. The chocolate pudding was tasty, when I could get to it, as I battled through the marshmallow topping.  After a quick search, I think Westwood also offers this menu as well. Parking sucks in either location, so if you must, get it to go so you can do the curbside takeout.

First time ever eating a CPK and I was not disappointed. TONS of different pizza choices and there's something for everyone. Whether you're a meat eater, vegetarian, or just fussy I can promise you'll find something that appeals to you. I was actually surprised at the interesting cocktail list too! And our waitress was SO friendly. Can't complain.

Took forever for server to even approach us, and when he did he did not ask us what we would like to drink, rather if we knew what we wanted. Never got the napkins we asked for and never got the bread and butter we asked for. Server never checked on us or refilled our drinks. Pasta was overly spicy compared to previous times we've had it.

This is our first visit to this location. It was good, but not as good as most (maybe all) other locations.  We were seated at a table and chairs that still had crumbs on them. After we brought this to the attention of the server, she did apologize and immediately clean all.  You would have thought that when the manager came over later to check on us, he would have commented on his own. .... he didn't,  but he knew about the situation. Not a big deal, but it was noted.  The rest of the dining was fine. Good food, good value, good service.  We would (and likely will) return to this location.
Me and my family eat here all the time. Food is great, service is good, and fast, and our favorite server is Ben. He is awesome. Definitely recommend this CPK.
It was good service but takes 1 hour to make food to long I would not suggest coming here

This particular location seems to do a better job than the one I usually go to in Culver City. The BBQ Chicken salad and the pizza were both very good, The waiter did drop the ball a little but nothing over the top as he corrected his mistake.

Bad service!!! I asked for bread three times, and it finally came with my food! I had ordered the garlic cream fettuccine, but when it came the sauce was green--when I asked if they'd changed the recipe the waiter told me they'd accidentally started to make me pesto pasta, but changed halfway through to the garlic cream sauce....they didn't start over?! When I asked him if he could correct it because I have an allergy to tree nuts (like the pine nuts in pesto) he gave this big sigh like I'd hugely inconvenienced him by asking him to bring me what I'd actually ordered....

For a CPK, the experience was okay, but not as great as other locations for a number of reasons.  We were surprisingly seated 5 minutes after we arrived considering the restaurant was not very crowded and there were several tables which could accommodate our party that were already set. We ordered our drinks (water) which came 10 minutes after we ordered and we ordered the macaroni and cheese for kids which came out very promptly (before the water). When we were ready to order, we told a server we were ready to order, under the impression that he was our server (if our server had taken the time to introduce himself, we would have know what he looked like). This server was not very pleased that we told him we thought he was our server and very coldly told us he was not OUR server and stomped away.  Eventually our server arrived and took our orders. The rest of the dining was fine and the food arrived promptly. The food was fine, nothing to marvel about, but remained consistent to other locations I have been at. The price of the entire meal was not worth the experience.  It is likely that I return (with lower expectations) as I have been to this location before and had better experiences.

Great lunch specials!!!! The food was fantastic and the place was packed.... Our server kept greeting us with a sweet Mahalo which makes me want to jump on a plane and head to Hawaii. The manager came out to greet us as well. The places was packed and the food is delicious!

I have not eaten at CPK in forever. It must've been about 2 years maybe. This is probably not new but I got the lunch combo special of a 7 inch personal pizza and a side of a salad for $10.95. I got the mushroom pepperoni and sausage pizza and also the Caesar salad. Both were good; standard fare.

Its CPK, you can't go wrong. Their pizzas are great and so are their pastas. The service is good and the place is clean. This is a renovated location so their menu is a little different. Their Chipotle Chicken Pizza is great, and their BBQ chopped salad is really good too. Great place.
Even though I waited a bit to order, the pizza was delicious. The waiter was friendly and my dad, sister and I enjoyed this place overall.

Well, if you're familiar with what a Sicilian pie really is and you love them, DO NOT ORDER IT HERE!!! What you get will be the complete opposite! That being said, they couldn't have been more awesome about correcting our* miscommunication. (*I say "our" because I am equally guilty of the miscommunication). In my world (and I was raised in an Italian family that owned pizza joints on both sides of the family), a Sicilian pie is a big, thick square pizza. We were shocked with what we got. However, the manager (sorry, forgot her name) was so nice about it and while they made us a fresh pizza, we discussed the miscommunication and I explained to her what a Sicilian pizza is in other parts of the world.  The pizza that we did get was delicious, affordable and well worth further trips to California Kitchen. One caveat, however... it is called *California* Kitchen. Don't expect east coast style food. It's a different world and now I understand to expect the difference and you should, too, if you're a recent transplant.

It's way too long a story to explain how we ended up eating at CPK on South Beverly Drive today. We normally go to the one in Marina del Rey or Manhattan Beach. But once we made our dining decision I was a little curious about how the Beverly Hills location would measure up with our usual expectations. Honestly everything was just a little better. First of all this location is different from the others. It's a more intimate setting. Not so cavernous. We really liked that. The service at CPK is usually good but not great. Our server Anjuli was totally on point for our entire meal. Even when she was taking care of tables around us she was excellent.  Now for the food. We ordered the Avocado Club Roll appetizer, half Thai Crunch salad (does anyone really need a full one of those?), half Chicken Caesar and a bowl of the Smashed Pea Barley soup. Every one of them was just right. Same recipes I'm sure. But the soup wasn't so overly thick (or gloppy). The proportions of the Thai Crunch salad, perfect. The ratio of crunchy noodles to lettuce to edamame to dressing is really what makes that salad work. The same was true for my Chicken Caesar (proportion wise) with the added bonus that the grilled chicken had great grilled flavor and was still so moist. The Avocado Club Roll was cooked just right and perfectly rolled so it stayed together as we were eating it. To top things off we sat right next to the window and had a front row seat for watching how people were dealing with the days sudden rainfall. How can it get any better than that?

I love cpk! Ive been going to cpk all the time for years and im the type of person to get sick of things easily. I either go with friends or family but mostly family. Theres always something to eat there whether its the thai crunch salad, the cheese pizza, the pea or tortilla soup, or even the pastas are amazing. Always good service! Get the raspberry lemonade or the piña colada!

My family is regular patrons of this CPK.  It is a chain restaurant, so expectations should be set accordingly.  They have a fabulous selection of cocktails, a very good menu, and a good core of fabulous staff.  There is the occasional server who isn't very attentive, but overall they're quite good.  This restaurant is small and fills up quickly.  Seating is incredibly cramped both inside and outside.  Inside gets very noisy.  This restaurant is always busy.  The staff get to know their regulars and treat them like family.  CPK has an outstanding kids menu, too!

Venue This CPK is my favorite; however, be prepared to fight for parking. There is a 2 hours free lot across the street (only during the day). There is also metered parking. You might be able to score a spot on the side streets, but BEWARE of "Permit Only" signs.  There appears to be a full bar, booths, and tables. The layout is not the cleanest, but it's very clean.  Food Admittedly, this is not my favorite restaurant. I know several people that love it. I just don't ever crave it. Plus, there aren't many vegan options without mushrooms. As always, I was craving carbs, so I opted for pasta. I ordered the Spinach and Asparagus Spaghettini (no cheese). This is perfect, because it comes in a marinara sauce. The portion is huge, so I only ate half of it. The pasta was nicely cooked, the veggies were tender, and it was the perfect amount of sauce. I don't want my pasta drowning in sauce. Service One thing that I have consistently experienced at CPK is great service. The floor managers always check up on the guests. The servers know the menu and are on point. This time was no different.
No matter how much I complain, they just can't stop watering down the soups!  Can you say RIP-OFF!!

This is one of my favorite places to go. It is inexpensive and really good. I usually get the Thai crunch salad and ask for avocado instead of chicken, which is absolutely delicious.  When I got with someone who also gets a salad, we get a flat bread as an appetizer. The flat breads are amazing as well  Their pizzas are also really good but I mostly get their salads. They are so fresh and tasty. And even though you're having only a salad you feel full once you're done eating.  I would definitely recommend.  On top of that, the service is always on point.

What a disappointment! I've been going to this location for over 10 years. Although the food is still decent, the service is definitely lacking and leaves something to be desired. The last two times I've ordered take out the restaurant has either forgotten to give me something I ordered or given my order to someone else (apparently that's possible). Yes, they actually gave my order to someone else and had me wait for the customer to return my food. When I mentioned to the manager this was the second time in a row there have been major issues with my takeout order, he acknowledged they've had "problems the past few months, but it's something they'll work on in the new year." Too bad it's still 2015. That said, I don't plan on sticking around to see if things improve in 2016.
The food her is usually good but today was a not as well. I am a vegetarian and the by accident gave me meat. Seriously, they shouldn't say something they can't do. By the way, they can't.

Cedar Plank Salmon is the only thing I've ordered for the past 2 years. Started coming here for the BBQ Chicken Pizza, years ago. It's still good... from what I hear. But now, that salmon dish got me like... Dope staff as well. Nicest people in Beverly Hills. Always a pleasure to come through and have a good dinner here. My favorite spot.

LaTricia helped me with a catering order yesterday, and handled the entire process with ultra professionalism and care.  All special requests were accommodated, all extra ingredients were included, and the event was a great success.  Thank you to CPK for doing a great job. The food was delicious, too. I will be back often.

Okay...let me start off by saying, I LOVE CPK and their new updated menu items. For those of us who are trying to get healthy this new year, I appreciate the healthier selections available. I came here with my family; I oprdered the kale salad with fish. It was good and light. My family ordered a thin veggie pizza with one side, one side that. The chef accidentally got the order wrong and they replaced our pizza at no charge.  This location is a bit on the smaller size as far as tables inside go. They do have additional tables on their outside patio however.  I really liked their California themed decor and pictures on their walls. It really set the California vibe even though it's still in Beverly Hills.  The staff and waiters are all very friendly and attentive. Love love love that they will bring you wine glasses if you order a bottle of pelligrino. It really sets the feeling of being classy in.  Last but not least, this location is more family oriented so if you're expecting a quiet outing, skip this location. Parents with big families and children tend to frequent here a lot. The noise level might become too loud for some.

We are new to LA, so we thought it would be fun to explore the ever famous Rodeo Drive and to do some window shopping. We had a leftover gift card from Christmas, so my husband and I stopped in here for an early dinner around 4pm last Saturday.  First of all, I would like to point out that this is THE original CPK restaurant.  It's a neat little space, but not that different from the other restaurants in this chain.  Still has fun decor!  Our server was great and very quick with refills.  I thought the food was delicious, just a *bit*  fresher than the other locations.  This restaurant is an easy walk to the high end Rodeo shops.  Unfortunately, we parked in a pricey garage, but I would like to point out that the city has cheaper lots around, so do a little research before you leave home.  If you plan your parking better than me, you can save a few more bucks.  We were also in and out quickly and we do appreciate that.

Wors pizza place ever come i order to go order they forget to place order the mean Girl Name ILONA say it will be ready like 10 min she was so mean and rude to people and customers who hire people like this with bad attitudes and bad personality shame on managers !!!!!!!!!!!!!! Never again!!!

The area is super cramped. The service did not pay much attention to us. A bag full of packed up food had been forgotten and when called and asked about it not too long afterwards they said the bag had been thrown away. Surprising for how much food was packed up.

To be honest, I did not expect the 3 star rating. I explained come here quite a few times in the past and although each visit was pretty God I really wasn't inspired to write a review. Today I came in for lunch.  After the service I received today I felt I needed to write this review. Something is going on because I don't remember this sort of elevated service in the past. The host opened the door. Sat be right away.. and offers so sort of reward card. Waiter Zac was there in a second or two. Food is the same.. good. It's always good. The manager stopped by to say hi.. I didn't read any of the past reviews but if service was an issue it certainly is not now. It was a good experience! Now I have to go back to work.

Ben was an excellent server. Ben greeted us with a smile upon being sitted. He took our drink order and offered us bread whie we waited for our drinks. He brought back bread then took our order. He checked on us periodically and asked if we needed anything extra. Our food didn't take long to come out at all. I felt like our food  was served to us ten minutes after we ordered. This location is not a very big location I would recommend this location for people who have children who decided that wanted to go out to eat. This place is not accommodating to large parties. If u want to bring a big group try a different location.
great service, food is awesome! i just love the tortilla rolls and the lettuce wraps!!  my kids love coming here!
Very nice atmosphere, great service, and great food. Defiantly worth a 5 star rating and I will defiantly come back!
This is a fabulous restaurant, such a great waiter Ben, and Eddie the cook is the best, Harrison the mgr is very friendly & accommodating, and the food is AMAZING ‼ I love this place ‼

BHPD took us out to lunch one Sunday afternoon and we had a good dining experience. Appetizers were brought out promptly along with the complimentary bread. Waters were refilled consistently throughout the dining session. The pepperoni mushroom pizza I ordered was crispy and delicious. For a chain restaurant, CPK knocks it out of the park!

I am a regular at the Beverly Hills California Pizza Kitchen and have had many of their dishes. I give it 4 stars because the place is crowded and there is always a wait.  I have had salads, chicken dishes, pizza small plates, soups, etc.  Everything I have had has been very good.  I like the Chicken Marsala with soft breasts of white chicken and fine Marsala wine sauce.  The portions are generous and I usually take half home with me.  Their soups are fresh and not too salty.  I have had their pea soup with half a sandwich.  I have had chicken Piccatta, which was yummy.  I had their Chinese chicken Salad which, for me is huge.  Even their half order is a generous portion.  I tasted a friend's Thai salad which was great.  I have eaten at both their Beverly Hills and Westwood locations.  Both have the same healthy food.  CPK it is!

Food here is pretty good. I had the Penne with chicken, a lot of their complimentary bread, and I also tried my friends pizza. I thought everything was fantastic except for the pizza. It was quite disappointing for a place that's called "Pizza Kitchen".  Our server was very chill and brought us bread and waters right away. He then took out drink orders. I tried some of my friends Sangria and that was delicious.  The location is quite small. We were seated inside since we didn't want to wait for outdoor seating. It was a nice night out and people waited to be seated outside. I didn't see any street parking, so we parked at a garage across the street for $5.

This place is so kid friendly. Food is good and menu is huge. Love the salad here especially the spicy thai I sub the chicken w avocado and they don't charge more. Lettuce wraps are a great dish too. My kids love to color with the papers and crayons they give and they always finish there food here. Always a go to for me.

Their to-go service sucks. The servers are nice but they just ALWAYS get my order wrong. They say a time but it's NEVER ready at the time they tell you. I end up waiting another 15 minutes because they don't get the order right the first time. Like seriously?  SERIOUSLY NEVER READY. They told me to come at 1:48 pm and I get there at 2:10. STILL NOT READY. It's RIDICULOUS. If the food wasn't good, we would stop ordering from CPK. PLEASE be more PUNCTUAL and MINDFUL of this. It's seriously a turn off and honestly a waste of people's time.

Coke is alway good, this location is very convenient and has plenty of seating available at the bar. They just did a minor remodel so the place is clean, a little loud but it was the height of lunch time. I would go back for the consistency of good good and good service.

Worst service ever. I don't even know where to start. They gave the wrong order and didn't care when I told them to get something new. The waitresses were so rude and literally said "I don't care" right to our face.

Visited this lovely neighborhood place for a casual dinner with family. Got seated pretty fast. Service was attentive and courteous. Dishes are however hit or miss. Our appetizers - white flatbread and avocado rolls- were delicious but the steak - new dish on the menu- was bearable at best. Pasta was pretty boring too. However Halibut was quite good and so was chicken pizza. And thank goodness for deserts! Chocolate cake with ice cream was delicious. I am sure we will be back to try other things.
5 star rating strictly for the consistently great service provided by Will and Ben!!

The host seemed genuinely cheerful and delighted as she seated us, which was a really pleasant surprise especially considering how rare that seems to be at a lot of restaurants.  Sweet start to our Saturday night visit already. Our server, Rafa, was so sweet and hardworking too.  He really got that upselling, prebussing, checking up, and speed with service down for the multiple tables he had at once.  I love how he concluded my night with a warm welcome back and said I was a pleasure to serve. Luis, the kitchen manager, was extremely friendly and inviting.  He was truly more than happy to listen to my feedback on their Wild Mushroom Strozzapretti, which is one rich and savory dish, I tell ya.  He was very attentive when accommodating for my needs.  He went above and beyond to ensure that the experience was satisfying. I can't wait to return and expect nothing less than the amazing service I received tonight.  Definitely going to this CPK as much as (if not more than) I go to Westwood; Beverly Hills CPK is way too good to pass up.
i wasn't in love with the food and service, but the location is near my house and i like the atmosphere

Butter Cake! Ask for their dessert menu and get the Butter Cake with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. To me, it tasted like a small round pound cake with sugar cooked on top. Apparently, the top is a thin layer of cheesecake, and it's oh so good.  Recommendation: ask the waiter to have chocolate sauce strewn across your Butter Cake!   Apparently it's very unhealthy, but it's sooooo good. It's dessert though: did you expect healthy? Definitely share it with a friend or two because you're probably full from your meal.

Terrible experience I'm am right now sitting here waiting for past hour for my order to arrive. Have asked for some extra bread and after being sweetly addressed there is still no bread and it's been 15 mins.  I'm hungry and haven't eaten since morning and they just made me even more irritated.

The service was horrible. The waitress never came back to the table for fill my glass of water. She only appeared to take the order and we had to get her attention for the check. I would recommend going to the one in culver city instead.

Happy New Year until you get to CPK Beverly Hills. Instead of honestly gauging the time for pick up, you are given an incorrect time that lands you at CPK almost 40 minutes before your order is ready. Shameful looks at management can be seen by other customers who were also surprised after waiting over 30 minutes only to find out thier order was still not ready. Either hire additional help or honestly quote the time for pick up. You don't have to be a rocket scientist to figure this one out. Customers will leave happier with thier order if you don't mislead them.

Just picked up our lunch & so disappointed in this food. Pear & Gorgonzola pizza is almost completely devoid of toppings. It should be called a flat bread because it's no pizza. DRY. Overly Sweet & hard. Pea & barley soup tasteless & gross at the same time. Chopped salad 1/2 order for almost $12. They gave me barely a sprinkle of chicken breast and at most 2 cups of salad. For $12?! The actual flatbread I did order looked like it might have been a full order at some point but that was certainly not what I got. It has been quite a while since I had eaten at one of these establishments since I moved out of the area. Such a disappointment. CPK used to be a restaurant that could be counted on for nice portions of good tasting food. Now they are overcharging for the most basic, badly done, fair. NEVER again! I'm not spending another dime here when there are so many good restaurants all around them. I don't forgive you CPK because I'm really hungry but can't bring myself to eat your sub par food.

Great place for affordable dinner w kids.  They give the kids actual pizza dough to play with.  We order one kids dish and split three ways.  Wife and I split an appetizer, veggie lettuce cups, and a pizza and Cesar salad.   And I get to watch the football game.

The management is lacking in this store. We usually have such great experiences at CPK. This one was in Beverly Hills so we expected a fancier experience but we got the opposite. Understaffed, no management, almost 20 min wait for our appetizer. By far the worst CPK we've been to, no wonder it was pretty empty at 6pm.  The tortilla spring roll appetizer was delicious but took way too long for me to actually enjoy it but the main course was very bland, I'm such a big fan of their pesto pasta and this chef seemed to just glaze the sauce like we were on some sauce rationing- end of the world-no more pesto sauce left deal.  The waiter was so nice, but you could tell he was super stressed, it was literally him running the whole place by himself while the rest of the team sat down eating and others just doing nothing and therefore also made everything slower than it should've been

I'm giving this place five stars because we had such a pleasant dining experience at this location. Everybody was very nice, welcoming and attentive. Our server, Ilona, was amazing with the service that she provided us. We never had to wait long just to be able to ask her for something that we needed. For ex., she came and brought us drink refills almost as soon as our glasses were empty, and she always had a smile on her face. That type of interaction goes a long way.

I love the pizza . The butter cake was so good  with  the ice cream ! Now it's my favorite dessert . I am in love . I got my food to go . The bathroom is way too small . There should be more than one bathroom . I am going to dine at this location  in the future .

I am so tired of spending money on take out and they mess up the order because they are lazy. I ordered an extra side of ranch that wasn't even filled half way. And the olive oil dressing was filled even less. It literally looks like it has been reused and that grosses me out. Because, maybe it is. The pizza was also cold and not what I expected. I hate doing this but I am so livid that I keep getting screwed over by lazy people.

location: La Jolla Shores, San Diego, CA
review: The first CPK that ever opened. I have to say I used to big fan of this CPK location. As I have been coming here since the day it opened. After being seated the server came right over for a drink orders. After several minutes we and my nephew ordered are food. I had the Waldorf salad with chicken. The salad was excellent. My nephew ordered the Thai Chicken Pizza that was total disaster. As the pizza was way under cooked and stale. The chicken was try. As it took the server over 20 minutes to bring a refill on an ice tea and a juice. Finally the manager came over to refill are drink orders. No questions the customer service needs a major overall. I have no clue why a person would have to wait over 40 minutes for a pizza. Not one time did the server ask if you need anything else while we wait. It took over 20 minutes to bring over some bread. You have indoor and outdoor seating. Overall the service was a big F. You have several parking options. From city lots to street parking.

Even though there are always a ton of waiters, the wait time when you're at your table is usually super long. The quality and freshness of the food has gone down in the past year which makes me sad because I like their menu. The reason I'm still okay with eating here is because they have simple food and it's affordable.

The quality has never changed throughout the years and no matter which location you go to. I love the BBQ chopped chicken salad and the BBQ chicken pizza. And new to the menu is Buffalo cauliflower and it is so delicious! Also they serve fresh bread with olive oil that is great and hard not to fill up on. However the service was to be desired hence the 3 stars not a 4. The waitress was inattentive, forgetful, and came across impatient. I asked for a small thing which was pepper flakes for my pizza and after awhile finally called another waiter who quickly brought me it. Not ok.

It's been years since I've been to a CPK and wow things have changed! This one is located on a very busy road. I parked in a two hour meter, but found out she there's public parking across the street.  Their menu has so many things I wanted to try, I had a hard time choosing! Finally went with buffalo cauliflower and the tostada pizza which has always been my go to in the past. The caulifower was amazing! Probably the best buffalo caulifower I've had.  Spicy, saucy and had blue cheese.  Yum! The pizza was just as good as I remembered. Service was good and attentive.  Our server even spilt our bill four ways without us asking and made it so much simpler!

Nice place and very professional customer service, the place is noisy but still kids friendly, good food, we usually come here with my family, my kids love this place, it's also walking distance from Beverly Hills TriAngel

I am a huge fan of CPK (and pizza in general, who isn't?) and this location does not disappoint! We went on a Saturday night and did not have to wait long for a table, and the service was pretty fast as well.  The staff was friendly, attentive, and conversational. I felt very welcome in the restaurant's casual ambiance. It is great for families, lunches/dinners out with friends, or going out on dates!  The food, as always, was delicious and high quality! I am a vegetarian and they have tons of options for people who don't eat meat, such as the margarita pizza, California veggie pizza, and more!  Also, insider hack/tip: order the spinach dip appetizer but sub pita bread for the chips-- amazing!! CPK is a great bang for your buck and always leaves me wanting to come back for more. You can find parking in the nearby parking structures. There is a flat rate if you come after 6 PM, and it's a short walk to the restaurant from there. There is also street parking by meter.
I love the BBQ chicken pizza! I've ordered this a million times and I still love it. Two hours free Parking is right across the street.
Super fun. Love their updated menu.  Always good. Spotless clean and super friendly staff. Mini new vegetarian and vegan options in addition to their classic menu and delicious pizzas
Horrible service,  nasty. We weren't seated for NEVER, RUDE host. We had to leave, never again.

Horrible horrible customer service! My work has ordered delivery once a week for years until today. First I was put on hold for 15 minutes, then I called back and was told they don't deliver on the weekends. Not only is it not considered the weekend (Friday at noon), we have ordered on Fridays before. I politely asked to speak to the manager, in which the very rude lady put me on hold for another 10 minutes. Will never give this place my business again.

We have been here before with a good experience, but last night was very different.  We were seated, given water and menus and then ignored for 10 minutes or more.  I was seated facing the kitchen and could see the wait staff chatting and lounging around the bar and kitchen area.  Our server never turned around to look at us to see whether we were ready to order.  Finally he came over, and we ordered a bottle of wine and food.  He went away again, and I watched him for another 15 minutes, doing small tasks for other tables, and again, lounging and chatting.  No wine.  Another table seated after us with a different server got their wine and food while we were still waiting.  Finally our server came over with another young man and said he was "handing us off" to the other guy for "a few minutes."  I exploded on the second server who was trying to mitigate the situation by offering bread?  Really, bread should have been offered with water 25 minutes earlier!  We left immediately after telling the manager that the situation was intolerable and I was too angry to eat there.  CPK needs to get a handle on their wait staff and make sure the customer's needs are being met.
Terrible experience. Extremely long to be served. Meals forgotten. Wine delivered when ready to pay
Love, love, love this restaurant, could either every night. Try the chipotle chicken pizza. Anything on the menu is delicious, however!
BEST chopped Italian salad!!! Salami, garbanzos, mozzarella cheese, the works!! I think this is the best chopped in town! Beats LaScala's chopped salad, to my surprise.

Took an hour and 15 minutes - way longer than originally stated. Then they messed up my order and tho I had requested no bacon and no tomorrow due to allergies my pizza was loaded with both. Also, the food was cold when it arrived.

The food is good, but the price you pay for their pizzas is just a freaking joke. You get 6 pieces, and it's like a 10" pizza. The salads are nearly 10 bucks and are also tiny. I love their pizza, but it's tough to justify paying these prices considering the portion size.

I didn't realize until my dinner partner and I were getting ready to leave that this is the original CPK! My friend said that there was a sign by the entrance. I met my friend on a balmy Wednesday evening (10/4/17). It was a little after 6 p.m. Initially, we met a Starbucks, which is right across the street. We ordered the pepperoni pizza, artichoke dip, and chopped salad. We also had Moscow Mules. We sat inside because we thought it may be too cold to sit outside. Our server was very prompt. Food was great. It's consistent with CPK quality.
Great introduction to the restaurant and a great server as well and I had no problems with anything here but to say "what a perfect experience!" From Andres to ILona our Server, Thank You!
Rly nice staff and good food and drinks. Wait time was ok. The pizza was probably some of the best I had in the area but the toppings were ok. Nice staff. Great location and easy to order.
Super fun. Love their updated menu. Always good. Spotless clean and super friendly staff. Mini new vegetarian and vegan options in addition to their classic menu and delicious pizzas

I used to like coming here years ago. A friends choice for birthday dinner forced me back and I must say that I can confirm my disappointment. Two years prior I was given a gift card for my birthday and ate at CPK in Studio City. Overall, what annoyed me the most was the very minuscule portion of Chicken on the pizza/Salad.  Anyways, this again occurred at the CPK in Beverly Hills. I ordered the Bahn Mi bowl and was highly disappointed- lack of flavor, and again, a minuscule amount of Chicken- for an expensive price compared to any other chain restaurant. I also had the Two in a bowl Soups- my choices were the Farmers Market and Sedona Tortilla. They were both tasty. The service was good, no complaints there. Overall, the stingy portions of Chicken have left a sour taste in my mouth with this place. I would  not recommend any dish with meat, in particular Chicken. By the way, it was $4 for Chicken added to the Bowl (which was $15). Crazy!

Nice clean restaurant and fast service. The food is amazing I love their pizza, and their Mac and cheese is so good sometimes order the kids meal. Their Kung pao spaghetti is spicy and flavorful, one of my favorites.
